speaker: Firefly
line: We're back to where it all began. You entered the Golden Hour from this place, and it is also from here where you will enter the true Penacony .

speaker: Firefly
line: It's a pleasure to journey alongside you once more, but it's time I laid bare the entire truth before you. As you might have heard... I also go by another name: Stellaron Hunter , Sam .

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: I'm fine... Sorry, I hope I haven't scared you.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: I'm sorry. I had no other choice...

speaker: Firefly
line: I know you have many questions... Do you remember when we encountered "Death" in that strange Dreamscape ? When I was caught by that meme...

speaker: Firefly
line: In that instant before it killed me, I saw the reflection of another Dreamscape in its ghastly pupils.

speaker: Firefly
line: So, following the clues in the script , I came up with some theories about the meme. That's why I instructed Silver Wolf to issue invitations, drawing everyone to the dream's hotel...

speaker: Firefly
line: I intended to call upon "Death" before you arrived, to solve the riddle using more direct means, and then invite you to join. However, contrary to my wishes, I couldn't defy the script , and I didn't get a chance to explain it to you.

speaker: Firefly
line: It is how you see now — I was impaled by the bladed wings of "Death." The heavy pressure of concentrated memoria miasma... exploded in my mind, as if it was actually reality.

speaker: Firefly
line: But after the momentary numbness subsided, I found that my body was absolutely unscathed.

speaker: Firefly
line: I was still alive, and it was just as I thought — I had arrived at a place starkly different from this beautiful dream. Beneath the Dreamscape of Penacony lies another more chaotic, more primal Memory Zone. Its name... Land of the Exiles.

speaker: Firefly
line: And so then I returned to the hotel in the Dreamscape, hoping to tell you of its existence. Yet I could not reveal my own identity, so I could only divert your party's attention and lure you away from the battlefield.

speaker: Firefly
line: And after, all my attempts proved futile. It wasn't until not long ago, when a crimson blade of light shattered the high wall of the dream, causing you all to fall far into the abyssal depths of the Dreamscape, that I was able to awaken you and your companions one by one...

speaker: Firefly
line: And that's it, that is all that's happened so far.

speaker: Firefly
line: I know it's tough to believe all this without reservations. I just want to say you're very close to the final answer — just one more thing needs to be done, and then I can prove it to you...

speaker: Firefly
line: Now, let's leave this place... Please close your eyes.

speaker: Firefly
line: Take a deep breath, and visualize the Dreamscape's outline in your heart. And remember... you must not open your eyes at all times.

speaker: Firefly
line: Three...

speaker: Firefly
line: Two...

speaker: Firefly
line: One...

speaker: Firefly
line: Don't be afraid. The one who has come to greet us... has arrived.

text: After a piercing screech, a thick and ferocious surge of memoria crashes into your chest, churning and ravaging. Your consciousness becomes like scraps of paper caught in a whirlpool, breaking apart, dissolving, and dispersing within the turbulent muddy current.

Innumerable voices resonate through the symphony of memoria like roaring thunder, and among them, one echo stands out with exceptional clarity. You know it comes from the girl beside you, your hearts beating to the same rhythm in silence, and then, more silence...
Until memories stir up ripples in that quiet darkness...

speaker: Firefly
line: I never knew you could do this.

speaker: Firefly
line: ...Do you have a driver's license?

speaker: Blade
line: I do.

speaker: Firefly
line: That is... surprising.

speaker: Blade
line: Why? Because this is Jepella , the city of sins?

speaker: Firefly
line: Mhmm, no... it's nothing.

speaker: Firefly
line: I'm just thinking, you haven't slept in twenty system hours... Are you sure you're okay?

speaker: Blade
line: I'm fine. I'll survive. Same goes for you.

speaker: Firefly
line: I'm not so sure about that. Slow down a bit.

speaker: Blade
line: Infiltration is over. Feel free to activate Sam anytime you like.

speaker: Firefly
line: There's still some time before the next part of the script unfolds. Let me stay a little longer in this body.

text: A long silence ensued. Neither of them brought up any topic, seemingly accustomed to this silence.
It wasn't until much later that a soft sigh once again broke the quiet in the car.

speaker: Firefly
line: Such a long tunnel. Didn't feel this long when I set off.

speaker: Blade
line: In half a system hour, it will lead us to Kafka , and then comes the downfall of the Jepella Brotherhood .

speaker: Firefly
line: Is that also part of the script ?

speaker: Blade
line: It's in your script , too.

speaker: Firefly
line: Sorry, I didn't notice.

speaker: Blade
line: Their destiny won't change just because of your selective ignorance.

speaker: Blade
line: I told you before, it's a bad habit.

speaker: Firefly
line: What about you, then? Is this the moment you finally find the "Death" you've been looking for?

speaker: Blade
line: As always, it's a blank slate. It's not on this planet. Why the sudden inquiry?

speaker: Firefly
line: Because I'm currently in a car with a sleep-deprived driver... I just want to get there in one piece.

speaker: Blade
line: This car has full self-driving capabilities. I'll just put my hand on the steering wheel. Will that do?

speaker: Firefly
line: Hey, don't take everything so seriously.

speaker: Firefly
line: ... Elio would always say there's only one type of destiny: The inescapable type. He can see the future, and we... likewise are aware of our "predetermined end."

speaker: Firefly
line: But before that moment arrives, we can still choose what we do... We all have this right, don't we?

speaker: Blade
line: After today, Jepella's name will disappear from cosmic history, and the Ever-Flame Mansion will take its place. In the not-too-distant future, you'll receive an invitation...

speaker: Blade
line: That's your next stop.

speaker: Firefly
line: Land of the Dreams, Penacony.

speaker: Blade
line: I hope you find whatever you seek there, be it answers... or salvation.

speaker: Welt
line: ▶ (Trailblazer), glad to see you're safe and sound.

speaker: Firefly
line: "Close your eyes"... This is the answer. Isn't it incredible? The monster that we have always known as "Death," is actually the guardian of the land of the exiles. It abides by a certain rule, abducting people from their dreams and bringing them here.

speaker: Welt
line: The question that has been perplexing us — "Does death really exist in the Dreamscape?" — appears to be a cognitive trap. It was laid by those orchestrating events from the shadows to cover up the truth behind the disappearances, and the existence of this fortress known as Dreamflux Reef.

speaker: Welt
line: Every emergence of that meme is related to the Watchmaker. Since Dreamflux Reef is where it brings its captives, it's likely that many of our longstanding questions will be answered in this place.

speaker: Firefly
line: The atmosphere here is starkly different from the beautiful dream. There are no regulators here like The Family, and they all look like they're mildly dazed.

speaker: Firefly
line: But from the whispers of the residents, I've heard a familiar name... Gallagher .

speaker: Welt
line: It's that man again, always in the right place at the right time... though that does save us the trouble of looking for him.

speaker: Welt
line: ▶ Himeko and March have already made a move. (Trailblazer), get ready. We're about to set off.

title: Mission Description
content: Firefly explains to you the deeper reasons behind her various inexplicable behaviors, and guides you to dive deeper into a place declared as a "nightmare" byThe Family... The primitive Memory Zone outside the sweet dream: "Dreamflux Reef." This move also exposes some of the truths behind "Death" — It is nothing but a tamed memetic entity that assists specific people who wish to travel between dreams. "Closing your eyes" is merely a strange invocation used to summon them.After a brief moment of discomfort, you realize that you have arrived at an abandoned old town. Once you have spoken with everyone and prepared yourself, alight and begin your adventure at this abandoned station.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (The real Dreamscape, the land of the exiles... Before we go, should we speak to everyone first?)

speaker: Firefly
line: I'm really sorry for waiting until now to tell you everything.

text: Why couldn't you reveal your true identity?

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Two reasons: Firstly, the script — in the future that Elio saw, Sam and the Astral Express' confrontation was inevitable. I tried to break the shackles of the prophecy, but this is as far as I could go.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: That aside... there were also my personal motives. I wished to travel with you as Firefly... and not Sam.

children.text: It's all right. I didn't take it personally.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: ...Thank you.

children.text: This is still hard for me to accept.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: I... I get it. Being cautious around a Stellaron Hunter isn't a bad thing.

text: Do the Stellaron Hunters also want a piece of the legacy?

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Elio only gave me one instruction: Allow the Astral Express to pursue the Grand Legacy. It means that the Watchmaker's Legacy holds great significance to Trailblazing, and to you.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Elio's scripts used to revolve and expand around certain specific Stellarons. But with your appearance, this condition has apparently ceased to be appropriate. Perhaps, he also saw the "impossible" in the future.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Do you still remember the medical cabin I told you about? Well, that's Sam — It belongs to the Iron Cavalry of Glamoth's Firmament Frontline, a Fyrefly Type-IV Strategic Assault Mech .

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: It is the cradle of my vitality, and the meaning of my birth. And for the longest time, it was... how I should have looked to the rest of the world.

speaker: Firefly
line: The timescale of Dreamflux Reef differs from reality, so we mustn't lower our guard. You're sensitive to memoria — A slight misstep, and you could get lost in this Memory Zone.

speaker: Welt
line: Something on your mind? Let's talk about it.

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: No wonder Miss Acheron is so averse to drawing her blade... it's hard to imagine such terrifying power could reside in an ordinary sheath. If it weren't for the fact that Aventurine 's power originated from the Preservation, the entire Dreamscape would have been affected.

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: Don't feel burdened by this. Even without that Stellaron inside you, Aventurine would still have found other methods to accomplish his goal. Let's just believe in Miss Acheron. And given her prowess, I don't think we've got anything to worry about.

text: What are your thoughts on Gallagher?

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: During your investigation, he shared a vital piece of information. Mikhail, the former Watchmaker who collaborated with The Family to construct the Penacony we're familiar with today, had a falling out with The Family for specific reasons.

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: But this is precisely where the problem lies — you were clearly investigating a murder. So then why, as a security officer, is he changing the subject to talk about his past with the Watchmaker?

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: And now with Firefly mentioning his name again... it's hard not to be suspicious.

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: Before we found you, she'd already revealed her Stellaron Hunter identity, and shared a lot of information.

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: Who would've thought that the Molten Knight's true identity was actually a young girl... For her, this is a secret that she cannot allow others to know. That being the case, I think we can believe she's willing to cooperate.

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: But, she didn't reveal all her secrets. I just can't shake the feeling that her situation is different from that of the typical dreamer... And I hope that doesn't lead to any dangerous predicaments.

speaker: Welt
line: I hope you've regained a little composure. We'll move out when you're ready.

speaker: Muddled Vagrant
line: Welcome to heaven... dreams, true or false... all are ephemeral...

speaker: Muddled Vagrant
line: Might as well drink more SoulGlad instead...

text: (As the player moves down the narrow alley)

speaker: Firefly
line: Keep going straight down this alley and it'll lead to an elevator. It'll take us to the center of the land of the exiles.

speaker: Melancholic Vagrant
line: Did you also get kicked out of the beautiful dream? I want to go back... but then, I don't want to go back.

speaker: Melancholic Vagrant
line: Tell me what I should do. Oh... I don't know what to do...

speaker: Happy Vagrant
line: Hi there, friend from a distant land!

speaker: Happy Vagrant
line: I hear the Watchmaker's Legacy is right here! Let's say we go treasure hunting?

text: Wait for the elevator to arrive

title: Step Description
content: Firefly explains to you the deeper reasons behind her various inexplicable behaviors, and guides you to dive deeper into a place declared as a "nightmare" by The Family... The primitive Memory Zone outside of the sweet dream: "Dreamflux Reef." This move also exposes some of the truths behind "Death" — It is nothing but a tamed memetic entity that assists specific people who wish to travel between dreams. "Closing your eyes" is merely a strange invocation used to summon them.As you ascend in the elevator, the sound of the old car parts creaking and groaning sounds like the lamenting cries of long-dead souls. Just what could be awaiting you in the depths of this "nightmare"?

text: (When the player arrives near the elevator)

speaker: Welt
line: What a huge Clockie ... Looks like the Watchmaker also left his mark on Dreamflux Reef.

speaker: Welt
line: Unbelievable... to think there's a settlement of this size within the Dreamscape... and all beyond The Family's reach.

speaker: Welt
line: The atmosphere in this fortress is... pretty different from that in the beautiful dream.

speaker: Firefly
line: When I first saw it, I was in awe too. The sky here, it's like... a reflection of the twelve Dreamscapes.

speaker: Firefly
line: What's even more bizarre, is that this place is also separated into trade and residential areas. The layout may be simple, but the facilities are very comprehensive. It seems that there are quite a number of people living here.

speaker: Welt
line: Though both Dreamscapes have distinct styles, the architectural designs are quite similar — works of the same hand, perhaps. Hard not to speculate on the connection...

speaker: Welt
line: But there's no point in overthinking things. Let's meet up with Himeko and the others first.

speaker: Firefly
line: Take a right turn at the end of this road and you'll reach the trade district. There are more people there, and perhaps someone knows where she is.

speaker: Welt
line: Not coming with us?

speaker: Firefly
line: The Astral Express likely needs room for some internal deliberation. In the meantime, I'll try and locate Gallagher.

speaker: Welt
line: ...Sure, let's reconnect later.

speaker: Welt
line: Letting her go was the right decision — further observations are needed before we decide whether to trust her. But first, there's someone I need to talk to.

speaker: Welt
line: ▶ Let's go, (Trailblazer). I'm sure you've already noticed him.

text: Yep, I saw him right away...

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: He's right over there...

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: Look, over there...

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: Hehe, not exactly — I've only met him once. Look, over there...

speaker: Welt
line: The Reverie Hotel 's bellboy... How did he end up here? And right after Miss Acheron severed the beautiful dream...

speaker: Welt
line: We'd better check, just to be sure.

title: Step Description
content: As the door opens, a cold and uninspiring plaza comes into view, along with two skyscrapers that had long past their glory days. Just as you decide to split up, a familiar figure catches your and Welt's attention... What could the bellboy of The Reverie be doing in the "nightmare"? Sensing something was amiss, you decided to go and speak with him, lest you lose sleep at night over this inexplicable phenomenon.

speaker: Misha
line: Ah? You're the guest from before. We meet again! And a new friend... F—Forgot to introduce myself, I'm the hotel's bellboy, Misha.

speaker: Welt
line: Hello, Misha. I'm Welt, we met in a dream...

speaker: Welt
line: ...Hm? And who might this be...?

speaker: Clockie
line: Tick-tock! Old friend and new friend, let's high-five!

text: Mr. Yang, you can see him?
Mr. Yang, you're still young at heart!

speaker: Welt
line: You're... a Memory Zone Meme?

speaker: Misha
line: Nope. Clockie is a good friend of mine. We all live here.

speaker: Misha
line: How did you two get here? This Dreamscape isn't supposed to be open to the public... I wonder if it has something to do with Sleepie?

speaker: Welt
line: So this is... your home?

speaker: Misha
line: Yep. After my work in the beautiful dream ends, I'll go back home. Commuting used to be more convenient, but ever since travel became cumbersome, Sleepie started ferrying people back and forth between the two Dreamscapes.

speaker: Welt
line: This Sleepie... Can you describe what it looks like?

speaker: Misha
line: Sleepie is a Memory Zone Meme, looks fierce and has many eyes. But it's actually really well-behaved. Gallagher's been taking care of it.

speaker: Welt
line: Based on the description, that meme is indisputably "Death." A nightmare for The Family, but for the people who live here... that couldn't be further from the truth.

speaker: Misha
line: D—Death? Not in a dream, surely. Sleepie's just a little aggressive, and sometimes messes up by fetching the wrong guests, but it would never hurt anyone!

speaker: Welt
line: I see... Has it brought back any guests recently, say in the last day or two? We're currently investigating a missing person case that occurred within the beautiful dream.

speaker: Misha
line: I see... Then you'll have to speak with Gallagher. But he's currently busy hosting a visitor from the Oak Family, and specifically asked not to be disturbed.

speaker: Misha
line: Um, Mr. Yang, the person you're looking for...

speaker: Misha
line: Is it Miss Robin?

speaker: Welt
line: ...Just as I thought. Considering what happened with Miss Firefly, this doesn't come as a surprise.

speaker: Misha
line: If you're looking for Miss Robin, I can lead the way. She told me that she'd be willing to meet with outside guests.

speaker: Welt
line: If it's not too much trouble. Also, we're looking for our missing companions: A woman with red hair, accompanied by a girl with pink hair. Have you seen them?

speaker: Misha
line: Oh, I haven't... But please rest assured — Dreamflux Reef is a small place, and it's not as bustling as the beautiful dream, but its safety is unmatched.

speaker: Misha
line: How about this! Since it's your first time here in Dreamflux Reef, I'll be your guide and help you find your companions, and then we can all go visit Miss Robin together.

speaker: Misha
line: She's gone to Mrs. Grace's to visit the children. She won't be leaving anytime soon, so there should be enough time.

speaker: Welt
line: Alright, then. We'll follow your plan.

speaker: Welt
line: Well, we now know the answer to both murder cases that have caused such commotion in Penacony. As for the intentions of the mastermind behind it all... we're still none the wiser.

text: It has to be Gallagher who's behind it all.

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: Yes, that's my thinking as well. I'm not entirely certain, but we still have to find him one way or another.

text: That visitor from the Oak Family is worth learning more about.

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: Yes, and I believe their relationship with Gallagher may run deep — why else would they be so clandestine about their discussion? Regardless, we have to find Gallagher.

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: Uhh, no idea. But its connection to Gallagher is worth digging into. Regardless, we have to find him.

speaker: Welt
line: Say, you mentioned before that you saw a Clockie that only you could see, right?

text: He was with Misha at that time.
You also saw him, Mr. Yang.

speaker: Welt
line: I can't shake off this strange feeling. Am I really still so young at heart...?

speaker: Welt
line: Forget it. It's not important. We'd better just follow Misha.

text: Follow Misha and explore Dreamflux Reef

title: Step Description
content: Misha claims Dreamflux Reef to be his home... If that is the case, you can only imagine how bad the treatment must have been atThe Reverie. Although, the cute and naïve Misha has not taken that to heart. In fact, seeing that you are in trouble, he offers to lead you on a search for your lost companions and give you a tour of the desolate town along the way. Not only that, you may even have a chance to meet with an old friend... Robin.Before this, however, you need to regroup with March 7th and Himeko. There is no time to lose. Better hurry after Misha.

speaker: Misha
line: Everyone, look! From here, you can see the most spectacular view of Dreamflux Reef—

speaker: Welt
line: A black hole? No... an accretion disk formed from consolidated memoria? Was Dreamflux Reef built on such unstable memoria?

speaker: Misha
line: Oh? So Mr. Yang is also versed in memoria dynamics. I was just trying to figure out how to explain this huge hole to everyone. I bet you guys have a lot in common with Miss Kaimee !

speaker: Misha
line: Look, there she is.

speaker: Kaimee
line: My calculations are finally done. In another ten system hours, the above dream will swallow the dream below! My hypothesis was correct — this place will cease to exist, as the dream devours everything...

speaker: Kaimee
line: Hmm? Who are you all, and why haven't you left yet? This place is about to disappear!

text: What are you doing out here?

speaker: Kaimee
line: I'm Kaimee, a dreamscape surveyor specializing in memoria dynamics, and this is my life's work that I'm researching.

speaker: Kaimee
line: See that huge gaping hole? It was just a narrow rift many years ago, but now it's grown into a giant hole. The surrounding memoria has been flowing towards the other end of the hole at a constant velocity, slowly but surely.

speaker: Kaimee
line: But the scary part is... according to my calculations, the flow rate of memoria has recently changed, and it's faster than ever before — it's almost... almost as if something is sucking it in from the other side!

speaker: Kaimee
line: By constantly improving upon Madam Razalina's memoria measurement method, I've finally obtained accurate results—

speaker: Kaimee
line: After ten system hours, the Dreamflux Reef will cease to exist! It will disintegrate like a melting glacier and then fuse with the sweet dream fragments on that side of the void!

speaker: Misha
line: Uhh, please don't worry, this sort of thing has happened many times before... Miss Kaimee isn't a bad person, she's just a bit... lost in her own world. She'll probably realize she's wrong soon enough.

speaker: Welt
line: You don't say... There was something else that piqued my interest. Who is Madam Razalina?

speaker: Kaimee
line: Oh, do you know her, too? Or are you also a fan of memoria dynamics?

speaker: Welt
line: We're very interested in Madam Razalina's achievements. Could you tell us a little more about them?

speaker: Kaimee
line: Why, Of course! She's an excellent scholar of memoria dynamics, and the first person to apply memoria rate measurement methodology on interstellar travelers.

speaker: Kaimee
line: Regrettably, due to the presence of the Garden of Recollection , ordinary people don't pay much attention to the nature of memoria. She departed this world without much fame, leaving only a few thin journals behind...

speaker: Kaimee
line: I came to Penacony to learn more about my idol, and went to great lengths to seek out Dreamflux Reef, all because this is her final resting place. Prodigies always meet their demise prematurely... If only Madam Razalina had more time, she would've discovered a way to reverse the flow of memoria!

speaker: Kaimee
line: I felt it, the source is in... the Golden Hour! There is a certain anomalous presence stirring the currents of the Memory Zone. I must uncover more concrete proof... I must convince everyone...

speaker: Welt
line: ▶ ...(Trailblazer), does the name Madam Razalina sound familiar to you?

text: It was one of the Nameless mentioned by the conductor.

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: That's right. It seems like she did a great deal of research and calculations in Dreamflux Reef... before abruptly passing away.

children.speaker: Welt
children.line: Before we came to Penacony, the conductor had given us a list of Nameless to look into — her name was mentioned. It seems like she did a great deal of research and calculations in Dreamflux Reef... before abruptly passing away.

speaker: Misha
line: Miss Kaimee regularly mentions her. I hear Madam Razalina passed away during the Prison War... If she could see the Penacony of today, its people building homes in the Memory Zone... I bet she'd be really happy.

speaker: Welt
line: ...Perhaps.

text: Follow Misha and head to the trading district to search for your partners

title: Step Description
content: Misha claims Dreamflux Reef to be his home... If that is the case, you can only imagine how bad the treatment must have been at The Reverie. Although, the cute and naïve Misha has not taken that to heart. In fact, seeing that you are in trouble, he offers to lead you on a search for your lost companions and give you a tour of the desolate town along the way. Not only that, you may even have a chance to meet with an old friend... Robin.Before anything else, you need to regroup with March 7th and Himeko. Misha believes that the Express Crew is likely in the trading district. Maybe you should go and check it out.

speaker: Misha
line: Our destination is the commercial district. That's where the largest crowds gather in Dreamflux Reef. We might be able to find the others there.

speaker: Kaimee
line: I felt it, the source is in... the Golden Hour! There is a certain anomalous presence stirring the currents of the Memory Zone. I must uncover more concrete proof... I must convince everyone...
Let me go...

speaker: March 7th
line: Please, come to your senses! I'm begging you...
Ghost, there's a ghost! D—Don't come near me...

speaker: March 7th
line: Oh my, I'm human and so are you. Can you get a grip...

speaker: March 7th
line: ▶ Ah! There you are! I've been waiting for you two!

speaker: March 7th
line: Quickly, come help! I bumped into a member of The Family on the way here. He was so scared and I just wanted to calm him down. But...

speaker: The Family's Member
line: Let me go. Let me go... I've only done good in my life. Why can't I rest in peace after death...

speaker: March 7th
line: ...Well, this is how it turned out.

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Ha. Ha. You're a regular comedian...

text: Now you shall pay respect to March 7th, Ghost of Dreamflux Reef!

children.speaker: March 7th
children.line: Me!? A ghost? Don't make me hit you!

speaker: March 7th
line: He thinks he's dead... Although when I first fell in, I also thought the same.

speaker: Misha
line: Dear guest, this is not the afterlife. This is Dreamflux Reef.

speaker: March 7th
line: That's right. Did you hear that? Repeat after me: Dream— Flux— Reef.

speaker: The Family's Member
line: You... You're talking to someone invisible. If I'm not dead, what am I? *sob*... I shouldn't have pushed my luck and tried sleeping in my dream... Curiosity kills the Pepeshi!

text: What's wrong with sleeping in dreams?

speaker: The Family's Member
line: S—Stop asking! You'll alert the monsters! All the dead are right here, all of them...!

speaker: March 7th
line: Uh... You're not talking about the Memory Zone Meme, are you...

speaker: The Family's Member
line: Don't say that name! It's all your fault! Th—They're coming!

text: (Begin battle againstMemory Zone Meme "Heartbreaker"×2,Memory Zone Meme "Allseer"×1,Memory Zone Meme "Insatiable Vanity"×1)

speaker: Welt
line: He passed out. His intense negative emotions attracted the nearby Memory Zone Memes.

speaker: March 7th
line: I see... but why aren't the other people around here scared?

speaker: Misha
line: Unlike in the sweet dream, people here don't see Memory Zone Memes as dangerous monsters... and even if they pose a threat, people can easily escape by forcing a wake-up call.

speaker: Misha
line: But we can't just leave this man here... Can we take him somewhere safe?

title: Step Description
content: Misha claims Dreamflux Reef to be his home... If that is the case, you can only imagine how bad the treatment must have been at The Reverie. Although, the cute and naïve Misha has not taken that to heart. In fact, seeing that you are in trouble, he offers to lead you on a search for your lost companions and give you a tour of the desolate town along the way. Not only that, you may even have a chance to meet with an old friend... Robin.You were able to reunite with March 7th safely. However, before you can go in search of Himeko, you will need to find a local to look after this poor soul that was scared unconscious by the pink spirit of Dreamflux Reef. This Aunt Jessie that March 7th mentioned sounds like a solid candidate.

speaker: March 7th
line: We can ask Jessie for help! I've gotten to know many locals while waiting for you guys.

speaker: March 7th
line: Everyone here is living a self-sufficient life... I don't know how to describe it, but this place feels like the real Dreamscape...

speaker: March 7th
line: Evening, Jessie! Uhm... is it evening?

speaker: Jessie
line: Welcome, Miss March! Who might these be?

speaker: March 7th
line: These two are my friends! As for the man lying on the ground... he's a scaredy-cat who fainted from fright.

speaker: Jessie
line: Haha, I see, another poor guy who accidentally ended up here. I'll take care of him.

speaker: Jessie
line: There have been a lot of new faces lately. Things must be tough in the beautiful dream. *sigh* The few remaining havens of freedom in Asdana will soon face trouble...

speaker: Welt
line: Do such things often happen here?

speaker: Jessie
line: Not really, but they're becoming more frequent now. Guess it's one of the signs of the sweet dream's collapse .

speaker: Jessie
line: This man has had quite the shock. Could you help me find a Halovian lady, March? Her songs can heal mental wounds.

speaker: March 7th
line: A Halovian lady...?

speaker: Welt
line: That must be Robin. She's also here, in Dreamflux Reef.

speaker: March 7th
line: Huh!? Robin? But I thought she... Oh, right! If Firefly is here safe and sound, then it means Robin must be okay, too.

speaker: Welt
line: Misha is about to take us to her to find out what happened, but before that, let's meet up with Himeko. You were with her earlier, right?

speaker: March 7th
line: We met some stowaways in the residential area. Most of them came from neighboring star systems.

speaker: March 7th
line: I heard that places like Dreamflux Reef are scattered throughout the Memory Zone of Asdana, like islands in the ocean. They existed before The Family arrived.

speaker: March 7th
line: I also heard that when Dreamflux Reef took shape, it was the center of all Dreamscapes in Penacony.

speaker: Welt
line: If that's true, it's no wonder there are so many similarities between this place and the sweet dream.

speaker: March 7th
line: Himeko must be gathering information. Let's hurry up and get going.

title: Step Description
content: Misha claims Dreamflux Reef to be his home... If that is the case, you can only imagine how bad the treatment must have been at The Reverie. Although, the cute and naïve Misha has not taken that to heart. In fact, seeing that you are in trouble, he offers to lead you on a search for your lost companions and give you a tour of the desolate town along the way. Not only that, you may even have a chance to meet with an old friend... Robin.Now that the brief episode of the spirit of Dreamflux Reef has been put aside for now... You can finally go in search of Himeko! You must miss her, right?

speaker: Jessie
line: There have been a lot of new faces lately. Things must be tough in the beautiful dream. The few remaining havens of freedom in Asdana will soon face trouble...

speaker: March 7th
line: This is where we split up... She can't be too far away!

speaker: Himeko
line: So that's how it is... I never imagined we'd gather the remaining details here.

speaker: Micah
line: Hehe... to borrow Gallagher's catchphrase, "what an unpredictable twist of fate."

speaker: March 7th
line: Himeko! Here they are.

speaker: Himeko
line: Perfect timing. Now that everyone's here, I'd like to introduce everyone to Micah, who's partly in charge of the land of the exiles. Micah, these are my companions.

speaker: Micah
line: ▶ It's a pleasure to meet the Nameless.

speaker: March 7th
line: You know us?

speaker: Micah
line: I've been keeping an eye on you since the day you arrived in Penacony. We would have met under more appropriate circumstances if Dreamflux Reef hadn't been isolated from the Twelve Dreamscapes.

speaker: Micah
line: Please allow me to formally introduce myself. I'm Micah, the Gravekeeper of Dreamflux Reef.

speaker: March 7th
line: Gravekeeper...?

speaker: Micah
line: Life in Dreamflux Reef is pretty liberating. Everyone here mostly keeps to themselves, without meddling in others' affairs. My daily task involves... cleaning a few tombstones.

speaker: Misha
line: You're too modest, Micah. When lost Dreamchasers stumble upon this place, you're the one who takes care of them, guiding them back to the sweet dream or showing them how to survive the wild dream chaos.

speaker: Welt
line: So, a guardian of sorts!

speaker: Micah
line: Hmm? Were you talking to me, Mr. Yang?

speaker: Welt
line: ...Hmm?

speaker: Welt
line: ...On that note, Mr. Micah, which tombstones are you referring to? We didn't come across any graveyard when we arrived.

speaker: Micah
line: Heh, they're actually just symbolic stones. But since you're curious, Mr. Yang, I'll take you there. I have a feeling you might find something of interest there.

speaker: Micah
line: But before that, you'll have an important guest joining you.

title: Step Description
content: When you find Himeko, she is speaking with a local named Micah. Coincidentally, this mild-mannered man who calls themselves the "Gravekeeper" is actually one of the people responsible for this land of Dreamflux.Your appearance in this land doesn't seem to surprise him in the slightest. He says that he would be able to take you to get a deeper understanding of Dreamflux Reef, but you must travel alongside a certain "special guest"... If you are not mistaken, this "guest" is quite likely Miss Robin.

speaker: March 7th
line: An important guest? Who could it be...?

speaker: Micah
line: This way, please. The roads here in Dreamflux Reef are a bit run-down, so watch your step.

speaker: Micah
line: There she is.

speaker: March 7th
line: It really is her... Miss Robin!

speaker: Robin
line: Everyone sang so wonderfully! It's not often that I try this music style, but I've gained some valuable insights from it!

speaker: Grace
line: I can't thank you enough, Robin. These kids have made incredible progress in only a few days.

speaker: Robin
line: It was nothing, Grace. I merely taught them how to sing. It was you who brought hope into their lives.

speaker: Robin
line: ...Life must be quite difficult for them in reality, I imagine.

speaker: Grace
line: That's right.

speaker: Robin
line: Whenever it's time to say goodbye to these kids, they're reluctant to leave. But, I've explored every corner of Dreamflux Reef, talked to everyone I met, and they all told me the same thing... This shattered dream is not worth clinging to.

speaker: Grace
line: Hehe, it seems you truly are a child of the Harmony.

speaker: Grace
line: Emma and Andy are orphans I took under my wing. Carol, there, with her blind eyes, used to work at a nutrition center in the outer ring of Penacony. And as for Gary, he's been living with autism since he was a child. They're not old enough to enter the sweet dream managed by The Family.

speaker: Grace
line: If we compare people to birds, these kids are like fledglings with impaired wings. But in this dream, they can fly freely. Even if they stumble along the way, they're still relying on their own strength.

speaker: Grace
line: And me? An old lady with no legs... Without this dream, I couldn't even walk toward them.

speaker: Robin
line: I'm glad that you found a new life here in Penacony, it's just...

speaker: Grace
line: Don't worry, Robin. Dreams have their significance, but they aren't everything. Both the children and I understand this. No matter how long we fly through this dream, we will one day return to reality.

speaker: Grace
line: But you know what? Emma and Gary aren't plagued by their insecurities anymore. No — and Carol is learning how to cope with her blindness. And Andy is livelier than ever. Well, even I've become more optimistic.

speaker: Grace
line: You see, in dreams, we learn how to live. Once we return to reality... we learn how to survive.

speaker: Robin
line: ...And should our feathers be damaged, then we share our wings with one another.

speaker: Robin
line: There's no need to covet an illusory sky in dreams, because we have the right and the ability... to fly towards a broader horizon.

speaker: Himeko
line: It's a relief to see you safe and sound, Miss Robin.

speaker: Robin
line: It's nice to see you all again, Astral Express crew. I heard my disappearance caused quite the commotion out there... I'm really sorry about that.

speaker: Himeko
line: Since you're here... can we assume that you're fully aware of the situation in Penacony?

speaker: Robin
line: Ever since I returned to Penacony, my voice started to change, until it gradually faded away. At first, I thought it was a temporary ailment, perhaps due to having been away too long. I thought maybe it'd just take some time for my body to acclimate to the high concentration of memoria in Asdana.

speaker: Robin
line: But now it seems... the root of the problem goes way beyond me. There are elements around me that don't align with the Harmony... and losing my voice is just one of the signs of the sweet dream's collapse.

speaker: March 7th
line: The sweet dream's collapse... that Memokeeper mentioned the same thing. So, it's real.

speaker: Robin
line: While I was away from Penacony, the boundaries of the Twelve Dreamscapes kept expanding outward. But whenever I mentioned the anomalies in the dream... all The Family heads refused to talk about it. Only my brother was willing to respond...

speaker: Robin
line: Later, I discovered the secret letters from the IPC ambassador, which further convinced me that there are hidden secrets beneath the surface of Penacony. So, following the clues in the Oak Family's dossiers, I found my way here...

speaker: Robin
line: ...The land of the exiles, concealed by The Family under the guise of "Death," a dream within a dream where Penacony's past is buried.

speaker: Himeko
line: Hearing you speak, it sounds as if your voice has made somewhat of a recovery.

speaker: Robin
line: I hate to admit it, but the "Harmony" in this place resonates more broadly than within the sweet dream...

speaker: Robin
line: It's regrettable, but The Family has experienced betrayal. The traitor, or traitors abandoned their original principles and, using the name of Harmony, exploited people's weaknesses to turn Penacony into the Planet of Festivities, trapping everyone in the illusion of the sweet dream...

speaker: Robin
line: This is not "the strong defending the weak," but rather "the strong exploiting the weak." A world without equality won't ever be favored by the Harmony, and naturally, those voices blessed by THEM ... have lost the ability to sing.

speaker: Welt
line: Could there be another force influencing The Family's shift in philosophy, Miss Robin?

speaker: Welt
line: Considering what happened with Acheron, it's difficult to conceive of another entity within the realm of the Harmony capable of influencing everyone, unless a power surpassing that of an Emanator is involved...

speaker: Robin
line: I'd heard about what happened to the Xianzhou Alliance . But as far as I'm aware, The Family hasn't faced any such external interventions. Who knows, perhaps I've just been away too long and missed something.

speaker: Robin
line: Regardless, I cannot accept my home is moving towards the very opposite of what the Harmony represents, while still claiming to uphold it.

speaker: Robin
line: I must uncover the reason why Mikhail cut ties with The Family, and who exactly it was who betrayed us all. Do you remember our arrangement, Mr. Micah? Well, here's my answer...

speaker: Robin
line: — I've decided to forego my role, and never step foot on the Charmony Festival's stage again.
